docs.lead_paragraph: Of the $540 billion in tax subsidies for housing, education, retirement and savings in 2013, the top 1 percent received more than the money received by the bottom 80 percent combined.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.

headline.main: House Republicans Propose Budget With Deep Cuts
headline.print_headline: Republicans Propose Budget With Deep Cuts

docs.abstract: Congressional Republicans introduce budget that slashes spending by $5.5 trillion over 10 years, balancing federal budget without raising taxes; plan relies on number of contortions, including deep cuts to federal programs, elimination of Affordable Care Act and assumptions of economic growth based on plan itself, in order to achieve aim while adding $40 billion in defense spending.
docs.snippet: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday cleared the way for Seattle's new minimum wage law to take effect as planned next month, rejecting claims by franchises of big national chains that it discriminates against them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bipartisan House leaders are working on a $213 billion plan to permanently change how doctors are paid for treating Medicare patients, a costly problem that's vexed Congress for years, a document circulating among lawmakers showed Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health insurer Premera Blue Cross said on Tuesday it was a victim of a cyberattack that may have exposed medical data and financial information of 11 million customers, in the latest serious breach disclosed by a healthcare company.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. House Republicans on Tuesday proposed higher defense spending and deep cuts to social services including healthcare for the poor in an aggressive new budget plan that seeks to eliminate deficits by 2024.
